articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces sent tanks into the western side of Gaza's Nuseirat camp in a new incursion into the enclave's central area, causing panic among the population and displaced families.
articles.title: Israeli fire kills 11 Palestinians as tanks roll into central Gaza camp

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Josh Smith
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol recently began practicing golf, for the first time in eight years, in preparation for future meetings with U.S. President-elect Donald Trump, Yoon's office confirmed on Tuesday.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon practices golf to prepare for future Trump meets

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lui Che Woo, the casino tycoon who helped propel Macau to eclipse rival Las Vegas in gambling revenues, has died at the age of 95, his company said in a statement late on Monday.
articles.title: Hong Kong construction titan turned Macau casino boss Lui Che-Woo dies aged 95

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police in the southern Chinese city of Zhuhai have arrested a 62-year-old man after a suspected hit-and-run attack at a sports centre that resulted in multiple casualties.
articles.title: Chinese police detain man after hit-and-run attack leaves several wounded

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description:
Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto congratulated Donald Trump on his election victory in a phone call after landing in Washington on an official visit that includes a meeting with President Joe Biden on Tuesday.
Prabowo, who has said he will pursue a non-aligned foreign policy, posted a video of his call to Trump made after he arrived from China, where he had met with President Xi Jinping on hi
articles.title: Indonesian president starts U.S. visit with call to Trump ahead of Biden meeting

articles.author: Praveen Menon, Renju Jose
articles.description: New Zealand on Tuesday offered a rare national apology to victims and families of hundreds of thousands of young people and vulnerable adults who were subjected to institutional physical and sexual abuse over the last 70 years.
articles.title: New Zealand offers national apology to people abused in care

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexico's Economy Minister Marcelo Ebrard suggested on Monday that the Mexican government could retaliate with its own tariffs on U.S. imports if the incoming Trump administration slaps tariffs on Mexican exports.
articles.title: Mexico economy chief suggests possible tariff retaliation against US

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations Security Council is discussing a British-drafted resolution that demands Sudan's warring parties cease hostilities and calls on them to allow safe, rapid and unhindered deliveries of aid across front lines and borders.
articles.title: UN Security Council considers action on Sudan war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The International Monetary Fund's Pakistan mission chief Nathan Porter held an 'initial meeting' with the country's finance minister in Islamabad on Tuesday, the finance ministry said in a statement.
articles.title: IMF's Pakistan mission chief holds initial meeting with finance minister

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea has ratified a mutual defence treaty with Russia signed by the two countries' leaders in June, which calls for each side to come to the other's aid in case of an armed attack, state media KCNA said on Tuesday.
articles.title: North Korea ratifies mutual defence treaty with Russia
